page.title: 04The Lundy Field Society.
page.content: The Lundy Field Society was founded in 1947 by Mr.M.C.Harman and over the years it has done a great deal towards conservation on Lundy.Until 1968 the Old Light was used as the headquarters.Nowadays members usually meet in the Tavern where they can exchange information and record sightings and other observations in the record books.The Society publishes an annual report and has conducted a number of surveys.It concerns itself not only with the flora and fauna but also with archaeology and other aspects of the Lundy environment. The Field Society have constructed bird traps for the capture and ringing of migratory birds.The use of these traps used to be open to all members but now the ringers for each week are specified on a rota for the season.
